circumstances: On final approach to Houston-Intercontinental Airport, the pilot encountered limited visibility (3/4 mile or less) due to night, low ceiling and foggy conditions. He failed to realize his altitude was too low when the twin engine airplane struck trees and crashed in flames. The pilot was killed while all four passengers were injured.
probable_cause:
Collision with trees and subsequent crash on final approach due to improper IFR operation. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Low ceiling, 
- Fog,
- Visibility limited to 3/4 mile or less.
